alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 08 at 2:29PM MDT until May 09 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE EASTERN PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Windy conditions will persist across the Northeast Highlands through this evening and again Tuesday afternoon with southwest wind gusts potentially reaching 35 mph. Critical to extreme fire weather conditions are likely Wednesday over all but the eastern plains with a very unstable airmass and strong to damaging wind gusts as high as 55 or 60 mph. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Tuesday. A Red Flag Warning has also been issued from 11 AM to 10 PM MDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watches are no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) until 8 pm MDT this evening and from noon to 8 pm MDT on Tuesday. On Wednesday from 11 am to 10 pm MDT. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts to near 35 mph through 8 pm MDT this evening and again on Tuesday afternoon and evening. South to southwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts to near 55 or 60 mph on Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 10 percent through this evening and again Tuesday. About 8 to 10 hours of single digit humidity is forecast Tuesday. 10 to 15 percent on Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
